Issues.Title: Measure text with charset shiftjis has some change after upgrade to .net6.0
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 6.0.100
<!-- e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info` -->

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No
<!-- Yes / No -->

**Problem description:**
When I call "TextRenderer.MeasureText" method, I found result is changed between 3.1.

In framework and 3.1, there is a little bigger than actual paint.

I found in .net6, default charset result is correct now , but for shiftjis our result is smaller than before.

Is this by design?

<!--
    Describe the current behavior, what is wrong or not working as expected.
    Provide as much information as possible, including callstack for crashes/exceptions, screenshots or animations.
  -->
```
 Font font = new Font("Arial", 20F, FontStyle.Italic | FontStyle.Bold, GraphicsUnit.Point, 1); // replace to 128 can reproduce
 Size size = TextRenderer.MeasureText("Item77777", font, new Size(int.MaxValue, int.MaxValue), TextFormatFlags.NoPadding);

 e.Graphics.DrawRectangle(Pens.Red, new Rectangle(new Point(10, 10), size));
 TextRenderer.DrawText(e.Graphics, "Item77777", font, new Rectangle(new Point(10, 10), size), Color.Black, TextFormatFlags.NoPadding);
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51563666/144778655-e5fdf031-6a88-4e5a-aa7e-c5dab5b49469.png)


**Expected behavior:**
<!--
    Provide details on expected behavior with screenshots/GIF, where ever possible.
 -->

**Minimal repro:**
[WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/7657602/WinFormsApp1.zip)
<!--
    Provide step by step guide to repro this issue.  Incase repro steps are complex, It would be helpful if 
    you attach a GIF with repro actions. Attaching a sample app to repro the issue will help speed up the 
    resolution. 
 -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Measure text with charset shiftjis has some change after upgrade to .net6.0" (#6295)

Issues.Title: Epic - Align with Win11 look and feel
Issues.Body:
Windows 11 implemented a new look and feel. While we get most of that automatically through the Common Controls we do have several places where we owner draw our controls and these should be enhanced in some way to look more aligned with Windows. This is part of our dotnet/planning/issues/27 theme.

I will be creating and adding issues to this epic in the coming weeks to outline precisely what we need to be doing.

- [ ] Investigate which controls need to be changed to align with Win11
- [ ] If available from Windows, expose a property that indicates whether the OS is in a Dark Mode or a Light Mode. I'm currently working directly with Windows on this.
- [ ] #6153 
- [ ] #5516
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Epic - Align with Win11 look and feel" (#6270)

Issues.Title: Epic - Improve Clipboard functionality
Issues.Body:
In addition to removing BinaryFormatter we need to make sure that we are creating a safe and efficient Clipboard feature area. This is part of the dotnet/planning/issues/27 theme. We'll add individual issues to this list as we investigate.

- [ ] Investigate limitations and problems in current Clipboard implementation
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Epic - Improve Clipboard functionality" (#6269)

Issues.Title: Epic - complete PerMonV2 support in WinForms
Issues.Body:
We've been working on improving our HDPI experience for the last few releases. We're going to put a significant focus on HPDI as part of .NET 7. 

Issues will be linked as they are scoped into this epic so that we can track them. This is part of the dotnet/planning/issues/27 theme.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Epic - complete PerMonV2 support in WinForms" (#6268)

Issues.Title: Epic- Remove BinaryFormatter from WinForms runtime
Issues.Body:
BinaryFormatter is an inherently unsafe serliazer. WinForms used it quite a bit in early versions and now we should remove as much of this as possible.

This is part of the dotnet/planning/issues/27 theme

- [ ] https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/1251
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Epic- Remove BinaryFormatter from WinForms runtime" (#6267)

Issues.Title: Expect some delays while members are on vacation
Issues.Body: Due to seasonal holidays, many of our members are taking time off. Please expect delayed responses until early January.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Expect some delays while members are on vacation" (#6266)
